columns.uid: The unique identifier for each user profile.
columns.name: The name of the user associated with the profile.
columns.email: The email address linked to the user profile.
columns.partitionid: The identifier for partitioning user profiles.
columns.followers: The number of followers the user has.

user_profiles.table_description: The table stores user profiles along with their identifiers and social data.

columns.f1: The unique identifier of the follower user.
columns.f2: The unique identifier of the followed user.

follows.table_description: The table tracks relationships between followers and followed users.

columns.id: The unique identifier for each tweet.
columns.uid: The unique identifier of the user who posted the tweet.
columns.text: The content of the tweet, limited to 140 characters.
columns.createdate: The date and time when the tweet was created.

tweets.table_description: The table stores tweets along with user information and creation timestamps.
